coding_practice.title: Ugly Number II
coding_practice.description:
An ugly number is a positive integer whose prime factors are limited to 2, 3, and 5. 

Given an integer n, return the nth ugly number.

examples.explanation: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 9, 10, 12] is the sequence of the first 10 ugly numbers.
1 has no prime factors, therefore all of its prime factors are limited to 2, 3, and 5.

coding_practice.explanation:
1. 使用三個指針 i2, i3, i5 分別追蹤 2, 3, 5 的倍數位置。
2. 每次取三個候選最小值作為下一個 ugly number，並對應指針前進。
3. 重複直到生成 n 個 ugly numbers，返回最後一個。
